title: Questions about NAV window
body: Why do I see “Incomplete data - no preview available” in the NAV window?

title: Questions about NAV window
body: This means that you are trying to view the data from previous calculations carried out with the old fund management functionality. NAV window shows only the data calculated in the FA Fund Management app.

title: NAV calculation warnings
body: When you calculate NAV, FA Fund Management checks the underlying data and shows you warnings if there is anything to double-check. To view the warnings, double-click the fund in the NAV status view and open the Warnings tab.

title: NAV warnings
body: NAV warnings mean that there is something wrong with the fund or NAV calculation settings, so NAV calculation failed. The reasons can be:

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account.

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account balance (normal when there are no earlier fees of the type).

title: NAV warnings
body: Cost formula is invalid and doesn't return any transactions.

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Share class and Portfolio warnings are based on the decision table rules that check share classes and portfolios. The default decision table contains the following checks that you can adjust:

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Negative positions or cash account balance (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 5% for stocks (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 1% for other securities and currencies (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1% (share class)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: The difference in the outstanding units in the current and previous NAV calculation does not match the number of units from the executed transactions (share class)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: FX rate has changed more than 5 % (portfolio)

title: Share class and Portfolio warnings
body: To adjust share class and portfolio warnings, see Add warnings for NAV calculation.

title: Limit warnings
body: Limit warnings mean that the fund portfolio positions are close to or outside the warning or breach thresholds set for the portfolio.

title: Limit warnings
body: Warning: portfolio values are beyond the warning threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: Breached: portfolio values are outside the breach threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: To learn more about setting investment limits in FA Back, see Portfolio limits.

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: To view the details of NAV calculation, double-click the fund in the NAV status view.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: FA Fund Management allows you to set up and use workflows that handle NAV calculation:

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV and fees regularly, for example, every day.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled NAV calculations.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: For example, if you have a fund that calculates NAV once a month, you can still calculate unofficial NAV every day to stay on top of the progress. You would have separate schedules set for each workflow.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: A separate workflow lets you handle deferrals:

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow for funds with income distribution. This workflow allows you to run deferral calculation in FA Fund management app and saves the bookkeeping postings before you calculate NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow is used for calculating NAV and fees for your fund regularly, for example, every day or every week. If NAV has to be calculated today, the fund has the Pending NAV status. During the calculation, FA Fund Management check your data and shows you warnings if there is something to pay attention to. You can view all NAV details in the NAV window (double-click your fund). When you accept NAV, FA Fund Management:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates the share class prices (see Market data info in FA Back reference for details).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates unit price for the incoming orders.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates NAV report and saves it in your fund portfolio’s documents.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates accrued fee transactions to the fund.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, executes incoming trade orders using the calculated unit price and generates deposit and withdrawal transactions to the fund portfolio. Transactions are grouped per share class, settlement date, and type (subscription or redemption). For example, one transaction is generated for all share class A subscriptions with the same settlement date. For more details about generated transactions, see Questions about workflows and NAV statuses.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, updates fund security allocations in FA Back. FA analyses fund portfolio investments on the NAV date and updates the allocation structure on the fund security in FA Back for the NAV date.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If your FA Fund management app is configured to run deferrals, and if you entered the accounting rules in fund settings (see Accounting tab), the system marks the postings that were used to calculate accrued income as "Reported".

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses of NAV calculation for the regular workflow are:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No schedule

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculation schedules for the fund aren’t set.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending NAV

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate NAV for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was already calculated.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Warning

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was calculated with warnings that might need your attention (see NAV calculation warnings).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Rejected

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation results were rejected by the user. NAV needs to be calculated again today.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Accepted

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation result was accepted.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Error

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation or acceptance failed because of the system error on the FA side (this is a rare situation). You can revert the changes and re-run the process using the Roll back failed calculation and Roll back failed acceptance buttons. For details, see Calculate NAV and Accept NAV.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: You can schedule unofficial calculation of NAV and fees for your fund between the official dates. This workflow is for your information only. It allows you to follow NAV for your fund. Unofficial calculation doesn’t price share classes nor incoming orders. The calculation workflow is similar to the regular one, without the last acceptance step.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses for unofficial NAV calculation workflow are:

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV needs to be calculated. If you didn’t calculate unofficial NAV for the previous days, you need to calculate these first to be able to calculate the current unofficial NAV.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV is already calculated. This status is shown only in the NAV window.

title: Non-scheduled calculations
body: You can calculate and accept NAV or unofficial NAV outside the schedule, if this is required by your business process. To turn on this feature, allow non-scheduled calculations in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab (see Fund wizard).

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: If you have deferral runs set up for your fund, FA Fund Management prompts you to run deferrals each time before you calculate NAV. A deferral run generates and saves bookkeeping postings for income distribution. Then, when you calculate NAV, FA calculates accrued income based on the generated postings. After running deferrals, the workflow is similar to the NAV calculation workflow.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: In addition to the NAV calculation workflow statuses, this workflow has a Pending deferrals status which means that you need to run deferrals before calculating NAV.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: Deferrals for a fund are set in the Fund wizard, Accounting tab (see Accounting tab). To learn more about deferrals, the Run deferrals section in FA User guide.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: What happens if I forget to calculate or accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: FA Fund Management doesn’t let you skip scheduled calculations. So if you didn’t calculate or accept the pending NAV on the previous day, you have to do this on the current day before you calculate today’s NAV.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: How can I set the transaction date and settlement date of client subscriptions and redemptions when I accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: The transaction date is automatically set to the NAV date (the date when NAV is accepted), so you can't change it.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: The settlement date of a transaction is copied from the trade order. If no settlement date is specified in the trade order, FA defines it based on the Fund settings in FA Back. The fund settings let you set the default settlement date as "transaction date + N days" (by default, N=0 and transaction date is used as a settlement date).

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: My fund has unpaid subscriptions that are executed during NAV acceptance but I am unsure when the client will pay. How do I handle them?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: To handle this case correctly, modify the trade order settlement date in FA Back. FA will generate separate transactions per trade order. You can specify the transaction type to use for such transactions (for example, “unpaid”) and manage these transactions separately.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: My fund has an incoming trade order from an account in a different currency. How do I handle the exchange?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: When you accept NAV, FA Fund management checks if the FX rate is set for the trade order. If the FX rate is missing, it adds the latest available FX rate in the trade order or transaction (if FA is configured to execute trade orders automatically when NAV is accepted).

title: Process monitoring view
body: The Process monitoring view provides visibility into processes that take place in FA applications. You can see which processes were run, how long they took, and if were completed successfully. If a process is ongoing, you can see details about its progress and evaluate how long it may take. The view also provides input for monitoring the performance of processes over time.

title: Process monitoring view
body: The system monitors processes such as user-triggered and scheduled processes, authority and client reporting, and custom processes. For example, for nightly price updates and report calculation, the monitoring tracks the process through the following stages:

title: Process monitoring view
body: Start

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch active portfolios

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 1 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Find applicable securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch and save close prices

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update cashflow securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 2 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 3 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update discount factors (if no connectors 1-3 defined)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Schedule report updates

title: Process monitoring view
body: End

title: Tracked processes

title: Tracked processes

title: Tracked processes

title: View the process timeline
body: In the Process monitoring view, you can see the timeline of process runs during a given period by choosing the start and end dates. To view information about a specific process, select the application it relates to. You can filter the list down by selecting a single process type, instance, or status. You can also adjust the time scale of the process timeline by using the slider on the right.

title: View the process timeline
body: The color of the blocks indicates the completion status of a run, with blue meaning ongoing, green meaning completed, and red meaning failed. Click on the process to view its information: start and end times of a run, its completion status, duration, and the user who executed it. You can expand the process run to see the stages.

title: View process details
body: To view the details of a process run or stage, click in the Actions column. The details shown depend on the process. For example, for the NAV acceptance process, you can see the date on which the NAV was accepted. If the run failed, you can view the error message. If the process was canceled, the details show the user who canceled it.

title: Process information
body: The following information is available in the Process monitoring view:

title: Process information
body: Start time

title: Process information
body: The start date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: End time

title: Process information
body: The end date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: Status

title: Process information
body: The completion status of the run. The status is completed for a successful run, failed for an unsuccessful run, and ongoing for a run that has not finished.

title: Process information
body: Duration

title: Process information
body: The duration of the run in minutes, seconds, and milliseconds.

title: Process information
body: User

title: Process information
body: The username of the user who executed the run.

title: Process information
body: Actions

title: Process information
body: The Actions column shows the button to open process run or stage details.

title: Holdings view
body: The Holdings view shows the client’s investments and lets the user buy, sell and switch securities. The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Holdings view
body: Holdings in the list are grouped by security type. For each holding in the list, the user can view its ISIN code, number of units, purchase value, total market value and unrealized profit since start.

title: Holdings view
body: The user can download the list of holdings in the XLSX file when viewing the page on a larger screen or desktop.

title: Holding details

title: Holding details

title: Holding details

title: Holding details
body: Prospectus. To make Prospectus available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL field.

title: Holding details
body: KIID. To make KIID available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL 2 field.

title: Holding details
body: <Security documents>. To make documents related to specific security available on the Holding details page in FA Client Portal, upload them to the security in FA Back (Security window, Documents tab), and add the "Online" tag. The documents will be listed under Prospectus and KIID.

title: Holding details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Tradeable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Holding details
body: Switch button for switching a fund position (or a share of it) to another fund. To enable switching, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Switchable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The Buy or Sell button opens the window to enter trade order details:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Number of units / Trade amount - Trade order amount or the number of units to buy or sell.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trading method:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Units - Create a trade order based on the number of units.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trade amount - Create a trade order based on the trade amount.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The user can also buy securities in the Trading view.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The Switch button is available for fund positions. It opens the window to enter the switch order details and create a switch order:

title: Switching fund positions
body: The share of the position to sell in percent.

title: Switching fund positions
body: Security to buy.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The approximate trade amount is estimated based on the position share to sell and the latest price.

title: Switching fund positions
body: When the user clicks Confirm , redemption and subscription trade orders are created in FA Back. When the redemption order is executed, the switch order in FA Client Portal is replaced with a buy order. The redemption is shown as a new transaction in the Transactions view.

title: About FA Developer app
body: FA Developer app gathers services for the third-party developers who work with FA:

title: About FA Developer app
body: GraphQL API — GraphiQL client to query FA over FA GraphQL APIs.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Reports — jsreport designer to develop and test report templates.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Workflows — Flowable modeler to design wor runnable within FA and Form.io designer to create interactive forms that can be embedded in processes in third-party applications.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Integrations — Camel platform to create and manage file-based integrations with other systems.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Notebooks — Jupyter notebooks to manipulate and analyze data from FA and external parties, as well as to store and share your work securely.

title: About FA Developer app
body: Authentication — Keycloak folders to manage and deploy FA custom login themes and other authentication-related customizations.

title: About FA Developer app
body: The access to each of the services is controlled separately with user roles. Depending on your role, you might have access to only some of the services.

title: Workflows view
body: The Workflows view lets you design processes runnable in FA:

title: Workflows view
body: Process modeler gives you access to the Flowable process engine – a visual tool to create business process models and decision tables and package them up for use in the Flowable app. Processes can be accessed through the GraphQL API.

title: Workflows view
body: Process admin view lets you manage processes.

title: Workflows view
body: Forms view gives you access to Form.io designer to create interactive forms that can be embedded in processes in third-party applications

title: Process modeler
body: The Process modeler section lets you create processes. The navigation panel at the top features model editors for different model types. For working with FA, the following options are supported:

title: Process modeler
body: Processes

title: Process modeler
body: Processes editor to create BPMN diagrams. The Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) specification provides a graphical notation for specifying business processes. To learn more about BPMN, see the BPNM standard description. To learn about how to create processes, see the Processes editor section in the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process modeler
body: Decisions

title: Process modeler
body: Decisions editor to define a set of business rules in the form of DMN Decision Tables. DMN is a modeling language and notation for the precise specification of business decisions and business rules. To learn more about DMN, see the DMN standard description. To learn about how to create decision tables, see the Decisions editor section in the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process modeler
body: Apps

title: Process modeler
body: Apps editor to create a bundle of processes that can be deployed and shared with users to run. To learn more about how to create and publish packages, see the App editor section the Flowable Design user guide.

title: Process admin view
body: The Process admin section provides you access to the Flowable Admin app. You can use it to:

title: Process admin view
body: View the deployed and running processes.

title: Process admin view
body: Stop a running process.

title: Process admin view
body: Import and export processes.

title: Process admin view
body: To learn more about the Process admin section, see the Flowable documentation.

title: Forms view
body: The Forms view provides you access to the form.io builder to design forms that you can embed in HTML pages. Forms can be accessed through the GraphQL API.

title: Forms view
body: Forms let you collect information that can be further handled by external apps. For example, an app can display a form for new clients to fill in and save the data in FA or print it out as a PDF. To implement this, the form should be included in a process via the User task element.

title: Forms view
body: To create a form, click Add form at the top-right.

title: Forms view
body: You can export forms and transfer them to other environments. To upload a form, click Import form at the top-right.

title: List of forms
body: The Forms view shows the List of forms with the following columns:

title: List of forms
body: Name

title: List of forms
body: The form name is for you to distinguish between the forms, it isn’t shown anywhere else.

title: List of forms
body: Form ID

title: List of forms
body: The form ID is used to include a form in a process (specify it as a form key value of the User task element when designing a process).

title: List of forms
body: Actions

title: List of forms
body: The buttons to manage forms:

title: List of forms
body: Edit translations. Use this feature to add and edit form translations, set the default form language, and export translations as XLSX files. In the Edit translations window, you can also preview the form in each language.

title: List of forms
body: Export form in a file that is saved to your computer. Use this feature to copy created forms to another environment.

title: List of forms
body: View, Edit or Delete form.

title: Related links
body: Workflows in FA Developer guide.

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks for existing customers and onboarding new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and edit customer information. You can see a list of all customers and select an individual customer to view their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related notes and documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and manage tasks related to a customer. For example, tasks can be reminders to call the customer at a specific time.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a customer's investments in FA Client Portal with access to the same view as the customer but without the ability to make modifications.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: Access to FA Advisor

title: Access to Client Portal
body: You can access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal in the Customers view in FA Advisor. To have access, a user needs to have the correct role assigned to them. See User access for detailed instructions.

title: Work with customers
body: In FA Advisor, you can see an overview of all of your customers and select individual customers from the list to see more detailed information about them.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: A unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. The customer ID separates a customer from other customers (the system does not allow more than one customer with the same customer ID). Customer ID cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The status of the customer record in the system. Customer status cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representative

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisor or asset manager who represents the customer. Representatives cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The language to produce reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The nationality of the customer. Nationality cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The taxation country of the customer. Taxation country cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s address information.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view provides an overview of all of your customers as a list. From this view, you can access the details of individual customers as well as open their FA Client Portal profile.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: To see all your customers in a list, open the Customers view. You can search and filter this list and choose to show or hide certain columns, giving you control of the amount of information shown.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Show or hide columns. Click Columns and toggle the switches next to each column.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Filter the list. Click Filters and choose the filtering options.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Save a view with selected filters and columns. Click Save view. You can set the view as the default view if needed. To open a previously saved view, click Select view and choose a view from the dropdown menu. To see all saved views and edit them, click .

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Export the search results.You can print the list of customer information or export it as a CSV file by clicking the Export button.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMERS VIEW

title: View customer details
body: To open Customer details, click in the Actions column.

title: View customer details
body: View and edit customer information. Click Edit to make changes to their information. See Customer information in FA Advisor for more information on the fields.

title: View customer details
body: View the customer's investments as a pie chart or a table in the Investments section.

title: View customer details
body: You can see the name, ID, and total value of each portfolio next to the chart. The chart only shows active portfolios. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, only 10 are displayed in the pie chart with the smallest portfolios grouped. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: View customer details
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMER DETAILS

title: Access FA Client Portal
body: To access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal profile, click ICON in the Actions column. You cannot make changes to the customer's FA Client Portal in this version.

title: View and manage notes and documents
body: The Notes section in Customer details allows you to view and modify notes, background information, and documents related to the customer.

title: View and modify customer info
body: You can view and edit text in the Customer info tab. Use the Edit button to modify the notes.

title: View and manage documents
body: You can view and manage customer-related documents in the Documents tab of the Notes section. The table shows you the documents that have been uploaded for the customer, grouped by document type using tags (see Preference - Tags to configure document type tags in FA Back).

title: View and manage documents
body: To delete documents or download them to your computer or device, use the Delete and Download buttons. To add documents, use the Upload button.

title: View and manage documents
body: SCREENSHOT OF DOCUMENTS TAB

title: View and manage documents
body: The following columns are shown for each document:

title: View and manage documents
body: Group

title: View and manage documents
body: The type of the document, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document types are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags).

title: View and manage documents
body: Document name

title: View and manage documents
body: The name of the document and its file extension, for example, PDF or XLSX.

title: View and manage documents
body: Uploaded by

title: View and manage documents
body: The username of the user who uploaded the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Upload date

title: View and manage documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Document signing

title: View and manage documents
body: The signing status of the document, for example, pending or expired. Document signing tags are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags). To modify the signing status of a document, the document signing tag needs to be assigned in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: View and manage documents
body: The availability of the document in FA Client Portal. To make a document available in the FA Client Portal, it needs to be assigned the "Online" tag in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: You can upload new meeting notes in the Meeting notes tab. You can also download or delete existing meeting notes similarly to documents.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The following columns are shown for meeting notes:

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting note name

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The name of the meeting note file.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting date

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The date and time of the meeting.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Author

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The user who uploaded the meeting note.

title: Add other tabs
body: The Notes section also allows you to add other tabs for your convenience. To create a new tab, use the + Add tab button and enter a name for it in the Note name field. You can then add your notes in the text editor.

title: FA Operations
body: FA Operations

title: About FA Operations
body: FA Operations is an application that helps back-office employees carry out their daily business tasks:

title: About FA Operations
body: Reconciliation – Compare positions and cash accounts from external sources to the data you store in FA.

title: Reconciliation
body: FA Operations lets you reconcile position and cash account data stored in FA with the data you receive from external sources, for example, from your custodian or a bank.

title: Reconciliation
body: Set up data sources. Set up FA Operations to receive reconciliation data from external sources.

title: Reconciliation
body: View reconciliations. View reconciled positions and cash accounts.

title: Reconciliation
body: Assign mismatches for further investigation.

title: Reconciliation
body: Fix a mismatch. You can fix a mismatch in the following ways:

title: Reconciliation
body: Correct the system data so that it matches external data.

title: Reconciliation
body: Have the mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Reconciliation
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Reconciliation
body: When all mismatches in a reconciliation are fixed, the reconciliation status is "Finished".

title: Reconciliation
body: Close reconciliation with known mismatches if needed.

title: Reconciliation
body: Track changes and view history.

title: Reconciliation
body: Download reconciliation reports for the whole reconciliation or for a chosen item.

title: What is compared
body: FA Operations lets you compare the following data:

title: Set up data sources
body: Reconciliation data is uploaded in FA Operations in a file. You can have multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Set up data sources
body: To make external data available in FA Operations, you need to complete the following steps:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: To fetch reconciliation data to FA system, you have the following options, depending on the custodian and the data they provide:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Use FA standard integrations. Currently, only DNB Bank and custody connection works with FA Operations out of the box. For details, see Bank and custody connections.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Upload the file yourself. To do this, you need to consider the following:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File format. If the files you receive from your counterparty are in one of the supported formats, FA system reads them as is. If the file format is unsupported, you need to create a mapping. Supported formats are:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: MT535

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: FA reconciliation file format (see Create a reconciliation file.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: The information to.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File upload. To import the data in FA, you need to upload it in the respective FA folder manually or build a Camel route that fetches the file automatically.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: For details about file mapping and file upload, see Import custom CSV files to FA.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: If you already use the reconciliation feature in FA Back, you can use your existing integration, provided that the integration delivers the files to one of the standard file locations {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/standard/ or {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/settlementDate/.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: To set up the data source:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Open the Data sources view in FA Operations and click Add data source.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Fill in the fields and define the data fetching options:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source name

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The name of the data source. The data source name is visible in the Reconciliation overview.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source code

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The code used to identify the data source. The data source code must match the name of the FA folder where the reconciliation file is uploaded. For example, if your reconciliation folder is .../nordea, the code must be "nordea". If you want to switch from carrying out reconciliation in FA Back from FA Operations, enter "default" as the data source code.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match portfolios by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The portfolio property used to match portfolios from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options: Short name, External ID, Name, Book entry.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match securities by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The security property used to match securities from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options depending on the identifiers you use: ISIN code, Security code, Trade code, Update code 1-3, Name. For more information, see ???.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data delivery schedule

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The schedule for fetching the external data to FA Operations. Define the frequency, date and time or enter the Cron expression in the advanced mode.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Use settled balances

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Compare only settled account balances.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include subportfolios

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include positions and cash accounts from subportfolios in the reconciliation.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Reconcile items not in the source data

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Identify mismatches if FA positions are missing in the external reconciliation file. If you receive position information from different custodians, turn off this setting to skip the positions missing in the custodian's file.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Date adjustment for data delivery

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The delay in receiving the reconciliation data. For example, if the reconciliation file received today contains the data for the previous day, set the date adjustment as "1". If the file is received on the same day, set the date adjustment as "0".

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone used in the data delivery schedule.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Click Save.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: After you set up the data source, it is shown in the Reconciliation overview, Upcoming reconciliations. You can view the reconciliation items when FA Operations receives external data.

title: View reconciliations
body: You can view reconciled positions and cash accounts in the Reconciliation overview:

title: View reconciliations
body: Assigned to me – The summary of reconciliation items assigned to you.

title: View reconciliations
body: Open reconciliations – The list of open reconciliations and summary of all reconciliation items.

title: View reconciliations
body: Upcoming reconciliations – Upcoming reconciliation data that is going to be received by the system according to the schedule.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To open the list of all items in the Open reconciliations section, click View items. To open the list of items in a certain reconciliation, click Open reconciliation. You can use the columns for sorting the rows. For the column descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To view a reconciliation item, click . For the field descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Reconciliation item properties
body: You can see the reconciliation item properties in the list of items and in the item details pane that opens on the right.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Reconciliation information includes the details of the reconciliation process:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Type

title: Reconciliation information
body: The type of the reconciliation item: position or cash account.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Status

title: Reconciliation information
body: The reconciliation result:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Match – The data in the source and in the system are the same.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Mismatch – The data in the source differs from the data in the system: the item is missing in the source or in the system or one of the amounts doesn't match.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Fixed – The reconciliation item was fixed by correcting the system value or marked as solved.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Not processed – The item reconciliation is in progress.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Errors

title: Reconciliation information
body: The mismatch details. The list of errors: Missing source data, Missing system data, Mismatch in amount, Mismatch in market trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in market trade amount in portfolio currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Assignee

title: Reconciliation information
body: The assignee of the mismatch.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment on the mismatch.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Position and cash account details show the system information about portfolios, securities, and transactions related to the item in the FA system.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account information for cash balance items. Account details include Source account ID and the details of the matching account in the FA system: System account ID, System account number, System account number 2 (secondary), System account name and Balance.

title: Position or cash account details
body: The item details show all accounts with the matching number found in the FA system. To open the account portfolio in FA Back, click .

title: Position or cash account details
body: Portfolio

title: Position or cash account details
body: The portfolio that contains the position or cash account in the FA system. Portfolio details include Source portfolio ID and the details of the matching portfolio in the FA system: System portfolio ID, System portfolio external IDs, System portfolio name, Short name, Book entry.

title: Position or cash account details
body: If a cash account is used in multiple portfolios in the FA system, you can view the list of portfolios in the item details. The amounts from all portfolios are summed up.

title: Position or cash account details
body: To open the portfolio in FA Back, open the item details and click in the System portfolios section.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Security

title: Position or cash account details
body: The security of the portfolio position in the FA system. Security details include Source security ID and the details of the matching security in the FA system: System security code, System security ISIN, System security name, Trade code, Update codes.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Transactions

title: Position or cash account details
body: Five latest transactions for the reconciliation item based on transaction or settlement date, depending on the configuration (see Set up data sources).

title: Values
body: You can view the reconciled position or cash account values:

title: Values
body: Position: amount, market trade amount in security currency, market trade amount in portfolio currency, purchase trade amount in security currency, purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Values
body: Cash account: amount (account balance).

title: Values
body: FA Operations shows the following information about the reconciled values:

title: Values
body: System value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the system.

title: Values
body: Source value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the external source.

title: Values
body: Difference

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system value (amount).

title: Values
body: Difference (%)

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system in percent.

title: Assign mismatches
body: You can assign a reconciliation or a certain mismatch to a user.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: To assign a reconciliation to a user:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview).

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Assignee

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user to assign reconciliation to.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: Click Save.

title: Assign a reconciliation
body: The user can find the assigned reconciliations in the Reconciliation overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Assign a mismatch

title: Assign a mismatch
body: To assign a mismatch to a user for further investigation:

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Open the mismatch (click View item).

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Choose the user in the Assignee field and add a comment if needed

title: Assign a mismatch
body: Save the changes.

title: Assign a mismatch
body: The user can find the assigned items in the Reconciliation overview, Assigned to me section.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: You can fix a mismatch in one of the ways:

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Correct the system value. Correct the data stored in FA so that it matches external data.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: Mark a mismatch as solved in case this is a known issue that you don't need to fix.

title: Fix a mismatch
body: When all mismatches are resolved, the reconciliation status switches to "Finished". You can view all reconciliations in the reconciliation history (see Track changes and view history).

title: Correct the system value
body: To correct the value stored in the FA system:

title: Correct the system value
body: Find the portfolio position or cash account: click in the item details.

title: Correct the system value
body: Correct the values in the position or cash account transactions.

title: Correct the system value
body: Open FA Operations and rerun reconciliation:

title: Correct the system value
body: For the item (click in the item details).

title: Correct the system value
body: For the whole data source (open the reconciliation and click Rerun reconciliation).

title: Correct the system value
body: After you fix the system value and rerun the reconciliation, the item status is updated to "Fixed".

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: After a mismatch is corrected by your counterparty, make sure the data is updated in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Close the current reconciliation with incorrect data. See Close reconciliation.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: Upload the corrected data in FA Operations:

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If your system is set up to receive external data automatically, you will see the new reconciliation data in FA Operations as soon as your counterparty makes it available.

title: Have a mismatch corrected by your counterparty
body: If you upload the reconciliation file yourself, you need to obtain the file with the corrected values and upload it to the system. The corrected values will be available after upload is complete.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: In case the mismatch is a known issue, you can mark it as solved:

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Open the mismatch (click View item).

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: Click Mark as solved and save the changes.

title: Mark a mismatch as solved
body: After you mark a mismatch as solved, the item status changes to "Fixed" and can't be edited.

title: Close reconciliation
body: A reconciliation closes automatically when all mismatches are resolved. You can close a reconciliation yourself if you don't need to work on it anymore – for example, if you receive new data or if you want to leave multiple known mismatches without fixing them. To close a reconciliation:

title: Close reconciliation
body: Open the reconciliation (click Open reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview).

title: Close reconciliation
body: Click Edit details and fill in the fields:

title: Close reconciliation
body: Status

title: Close reconciliation
body: Reconciliation status. Select "Closed".

title: Close reconciliation
body: Comment

title: Close reconciliation
body: A reconciliation note. Add a comment if needed.

title: Close reconciliation

title: Track changes and view history

title: View reconciliations

title: View reconciliations

title: Investment service costs
body: One-off charges related to the provision of an investment service All costs and charges paid to the investment firm at the beginning or at the end of the provided investment service(s). Deposit fees, termination fees, switching costs (costs that can be incurred by investors by switching from one investment firm to another investment firm)

title: Investment service costs
body: On-going charges related to the provision of an investment service All on-going costs and charges paid to investment firms for their services provided to the client Management fees, advisory fees, custodian fees.

title: Investment service costs
body: All costs related to transactions initiated in the course of the provision of an investment service All costs and charges that are related to transactions performed by the investment firm or other parties. Broker commissions (costs that are charged by investment firms for the execution of orders), entry and exit charges paid to the fund manager, platform fees, markups (embedded in the transaction price), stamp duty, transactions tax foreign exchange costs

title: Investment service costs
body: Any charges that are related to ancillary services Any costs and charges related to ancillary services not included in the costs mentioned above. Research costs, custody costs

title: Investment service costs
body: Incidental costs Performance fees

title: Investment product costs
body: One-off charges All costs and charges (included in the price or in addition to the price of the financial instrument) paid to product suppliers at the beginning or at the end of the investment in the financial instrument. Front-loaded management fee, structuring fee (fees charged by manufacturers of structured investment products for structuring the products which may cover a broader range of services provided by the manufacturer), distribution fee

title: Investment product costs
body: On-going charges All on-going costs and charges related to the management of the financial product that are deducted from the value of the financial instrument during the investment in the financial instrument. Management fees, service costs, swap fees, security lending costs and taxes, financing costs.

title: Investment product costs
body: All costs related to transactions All costs and charges that incurred as a result of the acquisition and disposal of investments. Broker commissions, entry and exit charges paid by the fund, markups embedded in the transaction price, stamp duty, transactions tax, foreign exchange costs

title: Investment product costs
body: Incidental costs Performance fees

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Column Description

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: %-figures for charges (top table) Fee in question / (Average portfolio market value during given time period + total ex-post costs) We compare to a gross portfolio value rather than a net value because comparing to a net value produces misleading results in extreme cases.

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Gross and net return (bottom table) Gross and net TWR. Note that this usually does not exactly match the percentages in the top table because TWR is not the same as a simple return!

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Other costs (currency) The sum of other costs 1-5

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Other costs (percent) The sum of other costs 1-5 / (Average portfolio market value during a given time period + total costs) = Other costs percentage of gross portfolio value.

title: Figures in Analytics+ view
body: Total costs and charges -columns The sum of the corresponding Investment services and Financial Instruments columns. We sum these up in the report instead of directly using the total field provided by Analytics+ because it would also include third-party payments of that category. Third-party payments are reported in a separate row instead of a new column.

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: Field Description Example value

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
body: ait.accountNumber The account number of the account in which the threshold is imported. FI4950009420028730

title: FA Format for importing account thresholds
